===Etymology===
Generally thought to derive from a Korean dialectal term for the fish, which would have entered Japanese as {{l|ja|松}}{{l|ja|魚}} (''matsu no uo'', "pine fish", possibly in reference to wooded streams where it can be caught), combining with or being influenced by the verb {{l|ja|増す}} (''masu'', "to be [[excellent]], [[superior]]", in reference to the size, flavor, and other favorable characteristics of the fish).
